Module count
Package count.model

Class GammaInvariant

java.lang.Object
count.model.GammaInvariant
All Implemented Interfaces:
MixedRateModel, MixedRateModel.RateMultipliers
public class GammaInvariant
extends Object
implements MixedRateModel.RateMultipliers
Rate variation model: gamma + invariant rate factors for edge length, loss, duplication and transfer.

Rate variation

Rate variation across families is by using a multiplier with a discretized Gamma distribution (DiscreteGamma), and possibly a separate category for a 0 multiplier. Rate variation is implemented for gain, duplication, loss, and edge length. (Loss rate variation often causes numerical errors though.) The model's rate variation classes correspond to a Cartesian product for the individual rate categories. Each rate variation has a Gamma shape category (methods getXXXAlpha), and some discrete categories, each with their own multipliers, computed as mean values in percentiles (methods getXXXRateCategoryMultipliers()). As an experimental feature, there are possible forbidden duplication and gain categories. The corresponding rate multipliers are 0 in those categories.
Author:
Miklós Csűrös

  • Constructor Details

    • GammaInvariant

      public GammaInvariant​(TreeWithRates base_rates, int gain_rate_categories, int loss_rate_categories, int duplication_rate_categories, int edge_length_categories)
      Instantiates a rate-variation model. In such a model, a cross-product of discrete Gamma categories is used for rates (duplication,loss,transfer) and branch lengths. For parameters on which variation is not imposed, the number of categories should be 1.
      Parameters:
      base_rates - tree with lineage-specific parameters
      duplication_rate_categories - number of duplication rate categories for rate variation across families
      loss_rate_categories - number of loss rate categories for rate variation across families
      gain_rate_categories - number of gain rate categories for rate variation across families
      edge_length_categories - number of edge length categories for rate variation across families

    • GammaInvariant

      public GammaInvariant​(TreeWithRates base_rates)
      Instantiation for setting up without specifying the classes.
      Parameters:
      base_rates - tree with lineage-specific parameters

    • setClasses

      public void setClasses​(int gain_rate_categories, int loss_rate_categories, int duplication_rate_categories, int edge_length_categories)
      Sets the number of categories for duplication rate, loss rate, transfer rate and edge length (in this oder of the arguments). For parameters on which variation is not imposed, the number of categories should be 1.
      Parameters:
      gain_rate_categories - a positive number, use 1 for no rate variation
      loss_rate_categories - a positive number, use 1 for no rate variation
      duplication_rate_categories - a positive number, use 1 for no rate variation
      edge_length_categories - a positive number, use 1 for no rate variation

    • setGammaMultipliers

      private static double[] setGammaMultipliers​(double[] A, double alpha, int num_gamma_classes)
      Sets the multipliers for Gamma+Zero variation.
      Parameters:
      A - multipliers filled in with Gamma values; if there is an extra cell 0.0 is placed there (for forbidden)
      alpha -
      num_gamma_classes - (=A.length or A.length-1 for 0.0 in last cell)
      Returns:
      A
